intro: Eriosema englerianum, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Eriosema englerianum is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
